text: Make the syrup. Boil the water in small saucepan and dissolve the quarter cup of sugar. Remove from the heat and slowly whisk into a shallow dish containing the green powder. Beat the egg yolks with vanilla extract in a medium mixing bowl. Add the other quarter cup of sugar until light yellow. Fold in the mascarpone cheese until smooth and evenly mixed. Arrange the biscuits in one single layer on the bottom of the baking dish. Pour half of the green tea syrup over the biscuits and tilt the dish to soak all the biscuits. Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the biscuits.  Dip the remaining biscuits in the syrup and arrange on top of the mascarpone mixture. Spread the remaining cheese on top. Lay a piece of plastic food wrap directly on top of the cheese to wrap tightly. Chill in fridge overnight. Dust with generous amount of green tea powder just before serving. Serve with a dollop of ice cream or a coulis of choice.
